snippet: Without an increase in crime, the burden is on the City Council to argue convincingly that 1,000 more officers are really needed.
abstract: Editorial questions New York City Council's call for adding 1,000 officers to the Police Dept; contends Council members must show why more officers are needed without an increase in crime; maintains until that happens, Mayor Bill de Blasio's argument that they are unneeded is more convincing.
lead_paragraph: Without an increase in crime, the burden is on the City Council to argue convincingly that 1,000 more officers are really needed.
